frameDefinitions: The words in this frame describe a period of time, as opposed to a point in time.
An Employee has a Position doing work in a particular Field, or doing work on a particular Task, for which an Employer gives Compensation to the Employee.
Ambient conditions of temperature, precipitation, windiness, and sunniness pertain at a certain Place and Time.
Under some Condition, usually left implicit, a Responsible_party is required to perform some Duty.
Artists work at various tasks that further the completion of a film, play, television show, or other similar Production.
An Agent expends effort towards achieving a Goal.
frameExamples: The best <t>time</t> of year for planting tends to be fairly regular.
Undocumented foreigners are <t>working</t> as  building contractors for Laing Builders.
It is my <t>duty</t> to fight any attack on the Brotherhood .
Steven Spielberg <t>directed</t> several films for Universal Pictures.
In addition, our organization will <t>work</t> on improving accountability in every department.
listRoleDefinitions: A quantity or other characterization of the <fen>State</fen>'s duration.  In this frame, the duration can be inexact.
An ongoing state whose duration can be measured.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform a <fen>Task</fen> in order to receive <fen>Compensation</fen>.
The <fen>Employer</fen> gives <fen>Compensation</fen> to an <fen>Employee</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Place_of_employment</fen> of the <fen>Employee</fen>.
The label given to a particular type of employment.
The <fen>Employee</fen> is obligated to perform the <fen>Task</fen> to recieve <fen>Compensation</fen> from the <fen>Employer</fen> .
This role identifies the <fen>Field</fen> in which one works.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> period during which an <fen>Employee</fen>  works for an <fen>Employer</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Employee</fen> works.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the weather occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the weather occurs.
The person who must perform the <fen>Duty</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> is obligated to perform.
The time interval during which the Responsibly_party is obligated to fulfill the Duty.
A location in which the <fen>Responsible_party</fen> has a specified <fen>Duty</fen> .
The <fen>Artist</fen> works off-stage to help make the <fen>Production</fen>.
The <fen>Production</fen> is the final product put out by the off-stage (and on-stage) participants.
An <fen>Artist</fen> may be categorizedy by <fen>Type</fen>.
Often (especially with film or television) the <fen>Production</fen> is advertised and transmitted to the audience by the <fen>Distributor</fen>.
This role indicates the particular orgainzaion that makes the <fen>Production</fen>.
This role indicates the <fen>Medium</fen> in which a particular <fen>Artist</fen> works or a <fen>Production</fen> is made.
In screen performances, the <fen>Performer</fen> is filmed as he or she acts out a role with respect to the larger <fen>Production</fen>
The music which may be performed in the performance of the <fen>Production</fen>, either in isolation or accompanying actions and speech.
A <fen>Scene</fen> is a sub-part of a larger production.  In film, scenes are sometimes recorded independently, and later edited into the final movie.
This role indicates the time when the <fen>Production</fen> is made.
This role indicates the location of production.
The <fen>Agent</fen> puts effort into reaching <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the <fen>Agent</fen> expends effort to achieve.
An entity that is centrally involved in the <fen>Goal</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> is attempting to acheive.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the effort occurs.
The place where the work is done.
listRoleExamples: <fex>He was a great actor</fex> in his time.
<fex>My Mom</fex> works for the Michigan Department of Agriculture.
My mom works <fex>for an Eye Doctor</fex>.
The undocumented foreigners were working <fex>at the organic farm</fex>.
Louise works <fex>as an engineer</fex>.
My dad works <fex>building houses.</fex>
Undocumented foreigners work <fex>in construction</fex> for years.

<fex>From 2000-2001</fex>, Mr. Eckhardt clerked for The Honorable Jerry A. Funk,
United States Bankruptcy Judge, Middle District of Florida.
Most people work <fex>in the city</fex>.
<fex>Everyone</fex> has the obligation to vote.
My job is <fex>to get to the other side of the bridge</fex>.
<fex>At that time</fex> men were obligated to marry women from their own community.
I almost forgot to tell you that <fex>in Sweden</fex> we are obligated to spend atleast 7.5 months in the army for training.
<fex>John Williams</fex> composed the soundtrack to Star Wars.
Ralph Smith produced <fex>the off-Broadway hit 'Why Is My Name Ralph?'</fex>.
<fex>Hollywood</fex> director
Even desperate producers would never produce a film <fex>for that television station</fex>.
The latest performance produced <fex>by The Umbrella Thesbians</fex> was a major hit in France.
He produces <fex>for television</fex>
This particular scene was shot <fex>with a local choir and dancers</fex>.
Silence of the Lambs was filmed <fex>in 1991</fex>.
The documentary was shot <fex>on location</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: a Committee of the Whole House
